Package org.luisa.miniwrangler.java.parsing

Class TextTransformCustomListener

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.luisa.miniwrangler.TextTransformParserBaseListener
      • org.luisa.miniwrangler.java.parsing.TextTransformCustomListener
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.antlr.v4.runtime.tree.ParseTreeListener, TextTransformParserListener
    public class TextTransformCustomListener
extends TextTransformParserBaseListener
    TextTransformCustomListener.java Class that listens to a transformation DSL parser and builds the specified transformations depending on the rule being parsed
    Author:
    Luisa Pinto

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void enterConcat​(TextTransformParser.ConcatContext ctx)
      On entering a 'concat' rule create a new TextTransformConcat builder
      void enterDelimeter​(TextTransformParser.DelimeterContext ctx)
      On entering the a 'delimeter' rule set the delimiter for the a 'concat' transformation
      void enterFixedValue​(TextTransformParser.FixedValueContext ctx)
      On entering a 'fixedValue' rule create a new TextTransformFixedValue builder
      void enterOrderField​(TextTransformParser.OrderFieldContext ctx)
      On entering a order field set it as target field on the transformation being built
      void enterPattern​(TextTransformParser.PatternContext ctx)
      On entering a pattern set it as expected pattern on the transformation being built
      void enterRename​(TextTransformParser.RenameContext ctx)
      On entering a 'rename' rule create a new TextTransformRename builder
      void enterSrcField​(TextTransformParser.SrcFieldContext ctx)
      On entering a source field set it as source field on the transformation being built
      void enterValue​(TextTransformParser.ValueContext ctx)
      On entering a value set it has the value for a 'fixedValue' transformation
      void exitTransformation​(TextTransformParser.TransformationContext ctx)
      On exiting a transformation rule adds the transformation to the list of transformations and the source its source field to the set of source fields
      void exitTransformations​(TextTransformParser.TransformationsContext ctx)
      On exiting th transformations dsl file log the number of transformations created
      java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getSrcFields()
      Return source fields
      java.util.Collection<ITextTransform> getTransformations()
